p: Its pharmacological properties have been attributed to the presence of polyphenols such as xanthones, anthocyanins, phenolic acids, and flavonoids [ 142, 150]. It has demonstrated antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, antitumoral, antibacterial, antifungal, antiviral, and anti-allergic properties [ 150, 151]. Alfa-mangostin ( 49) is one of the most abundant xanthones in G. mangostana. The presented anti-inflammatory effects have been evidenced by reduced levels of TNF-Î± and IL-6 [ 152, 153]. It has also shown antihyperglycemic, antioxidant, and anti-inflammatory effects, as well as improved blood flux and integrity of the retina [ 153, 154]. The fruit has also produced improved results in terms of adiposity, hyperlipidemia, insulin resistance, and hepatic lesion related to ageing [ 155].
